Class VisualEffectsManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.view.VisualEffectsManager
public class VisualEffectsManager extends Object
VisualEffectsManager manages all visual effects in the game including: - Nebula clouds (background cosmic effects) - Pixel stars (twinkling starfield) - Shooting stars (animated streaks across screen) - Flicker effects (screen flickering for Level 3) - Intro sequence animations This class centralizes visual effect logic that was previously scattered across GuiController, making the controller more focused on coordination.

  • Constructor Details

    • VisualEffectsManager

      public VisualEffectsManager(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pixelStarLayer, javafx.scene.layout.Pane mainContent, javafx.scene.layout.Pane gamePanel)
      Creates a new VisualEffectsManager.
      Parameters:
      pixelStarLayer - the layer where stars and nebula effects are rendered
      mainContent - the main content pane (used for flicker effects)
      gamePanel - the game panel (used for flicker effects)

  • Method Details

    • playIntroSequence

      public void playIntroSequence(Runnable onComplete)
      Plays the complete intro sequence including fade-in effect.
      Parameters:
      onComplete - callback to execute after intro completes

    • setupBackgroundEffects

      public void setupBackgroundEffects()
      Sets up and starts all background visual effects (nebula clouds, pixel stars, shooting stars).

    • startFlickerEffect

      public void startFlickerEffect()
      Starts the flicker effect for Level 3. The screen will periodically flicker every 30 seconds.

    • stopFlickerEffect

      public void stopFlickerEffect()
      Stops the flicker effect and resets opacity to normal.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Stops all visual effects and cleans up resources.
